import java.util.Scanner;

public class Para_Func {

	public static void main(String[] args) 
	{
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		acc();
	}
	
	public static void acc()
	{
		int num1,us_id=121,pass=111;
		Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);
		System.out.println("Enter two numbers");
		num1=sc.nextInt();
		factorial(num1,us_id,pass);
		SOD(num1);
	}
	
	public static void factorial(int num,int UI,int UP)
	{
		System.out.println("The user Id is ="+UI+" And the password is="+UP);
		int f=1;
		while(num>0)
		{
			f=f*num;
			num--;
		}
		System.out.println("The factorial is="+f);
	}
	public static char SOD(int num)
	{
		int r,sum=0;
		do
		{
			r=num%10;
			sum=sum+r;
			num=num/10;
		}while(num>0);
		System.out.println("The sum of  digit is="+sum);
		
		char abc='M';
		return abc;
	}
}

----------------
import java.util.Scanner;

public class Function_demo 
{
	 int num1,num2;
	
	public static void main(String[] args) 
	{
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		Function_demo obj=new Function_demo();
		obj.accept_Val();
		obj.add_no();
	}
	public void accept_Val()
	{
		
		Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);
		System.out.println("Enter two numbers");
		num1=sc.nextInt();
		num2=sc.nextInt();

	}
	

	public void add_no() // Normal Function
	{
		
		System.out.println("The no is ="+ num1+" and second no is ="+num2);
		//System.out.println("The password is ="+swapp());
		int res= swapp();
		System.out.println("The result is ="+res);
		
	}
	public int swapp() // Return type in function
	{
		 int pass=121;
		 int user_id=156;
		//System.out.println("The password is ="+pass);
		
		return pass;
	}
}
